page.title: 02RADIO DEVON
page.content:
The{BBC local radio}station for Devon is based in Exeter. It reaches the whole of the county, and is on the air for 12 hours every day, 365 days in the year. Programmes are mostly live, and include 70% speech to 30% music. There are{70000}listeners each day, mainly in the 35+ age group.
There are{30 staff}in the station, of whom 8 or 9 are producers of programmes and 3 are engineers. The Programme Organiser is John Lily. News is gathered by local reporters, the police and other services and the general public.
The station opened in{1983.}There are three studios (and one in Plymouth). It cost Â£m1 to build.
